oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Circus people raising a tent, Nashville, Tennessee, 1938
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Circus staff putting up a canvas tent in Nashville, Tennessee. This photo relates to one of the two railroad tented circuses playing Nashville in the fall of 1938: Robbins Bros. Circus played the lot across Fourth Avenue from the Fairgrounds on August 29th, 1938 and there was a “Features Show” at Centennial Park on October 26th, 1938, the Al G Barnes and Sells-Floto Combined Circus presenting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Stupendus New Features. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Circus--Tennessee--Nashville
